page.title: 11Wickhamford Church - one
page.content: This Church is named after St.John the Baptist. It stands in the Manor grounds, which once belonged to the Abbey in Evesham.The monks visiting the Manor would have worshiped there. This makes it understandable that the church is comparitively small and has a cosy atmosphere. The oldest part of this building is the chancel which is 700 years old. The nave was built in Stuart times, then later on the tower was built in 1986. The wooden pulpit is unusual. It is a three decker, the lectern, Vicar's seat and pulpit proper. The roof is made from strong oak beams in a design called "queen posts." At the west end there is a gallery for the choir with a panelled front. There are two kinds of pews.
